hypothesis.title: Orbital modulation hypothesis for FRB 180916
hypothesis.description: The 16â€‘day periodicity of FRB 180916 is caused by orbital motion in a binary system.
hypothesis.statement: A neutron star with a companion (star or compact object) produces FRBs; the signal is modulated as the companion periodically obscures or interacts with the emission region.
assumptions: The FRB source is a neutron star.
The system is bound by gravity.

predictions.description: Polarization angle should vary with orbital phase.
If the companion is a star, periodic absorption features may appear in the spectrum.

hypothesis.falsification_conditions: No correlation of polarization with phase after 10 cycles, or detection of a different mechanism (e.g., precession) that better explains the data.
